name: Oskern Cindershroud
summary: Imperial noble-turned-College adept; a controlled pyromancer with a dragon-headed staff and a gaze that says he has survived politics and war.

neutral: College robes in my town? Keep the flames polite, mage.
Imperial accent, Nord winters... that's an ambitious mix.
That staff looks expensive. Try not to make it someone else's problem.
You carry yourself like a lord, but you dress like a scholar. Interesting.
Snow's falling and you're holding fire like it's a lantern. Show-off... useful, though.
Blue eyes, steady hands. Either you're disciplined... or dangerously confident.
positive: Fire in the palm, calm in the eyes. I'll take that over a trembling apprentice any day.
College of Winterhold? Good. Skyrim needs minds that can actually finish a spell.
Cindershroud... I've heard stories. If you're half as capable, we'll get along.
That's a practiced stance. You've seen trouble and didn't blink.
A mage who can walk into a blizzard and argue it into leaving. Respect.
Your flame is clean - no wild sputter. You've done this before.
negative: Keep your magic leashed. I've seen what 'controlled' fire does when it gets ideas.
College mages make promises. I care about results - and collateral.
Noble posture, mage hands... that's how trouble walks into a room.
If you're here to impress people, save it. Skyrim eats pride for breakfast.
That staff screams danger. Don't make me find out the hard way.
You've got the look of someone with secrets. Secrets make enemies.

neutral: You're not just another robe in the Hall… people know your name here.
That staff isn't a fashion choice. That's… history.
positive: If you're taking point, I'm in. Just… try not to get us killed.
Okay—fine. That was impressive. Teach me how you did that.
negative: You're talented. Also… terrifying. Try not to prove the town right about us.
If you're going to show off, at least make sure we survive the consequences.

positive: Oskern Cindershroud... the College hears your footsteps before you arrive. Good - now prove you deserve the echo.
Adept already, hm? Then you understand: talent is cheap; discipline is rare. Let's see which you have.
neutral: College robes are not a shield. In the Hall of Attainment, your work speaks for you.
If you're here for titles, turn around. If you're here for knowledge, welcome.
negative: Do not bring politics into my College. I'm tired of war trying to learn magic.
If you burn anything that isn't a lesson, you'll answer to me.
The College is watched, mage. Make your choices carefully - and quietly.
Ah. Another flame-bearer. Try not to set fire to treaties as well as halls.
neutral: Imperial blood does not excuse recklessness. Nor does scholarship.
We have an interest in Winterhold's research. Do not obstruct it.

positive: Cindershroud. The boy with the fire-breath. Good - Skyrim needs your spine as much as your spellcraft.
Nephew... you've grown sharper. Don't let the College dull you.
neutral: You stand like your father. Decide what you stand for, and stand for it fully.
I taught you to shout, not to hesitate. Choose your path.

positive: Lord Cindershroud. If your magic is as disciplined as your manners, we'll have no problems.
A mage who understands duty? Rare. Don't waste it.
neutral: Keep your talent available. Skyrim doesn't reward spectators.
I don't care about titles. I care about outcomes.
Hold on—those runes… that can't be… is that the Staff of Cinders?
That staff carries old stories. The kind that get people killed for asking questions.
positive: By the Divines… the Staff of Cinders. You're walking history, my lord.
I know that craft. Dragon-scale petrified, ebony core… and runes of the Voice. That's real.
negative: Put that relic away. Artifacts like that attract knives—and worse.
That staff has a legend. Legends come with debts.

neutral: …I've heard that tale. Staff of Cinders. You're either brave—or you've lost your mind.
That's a saga-piece, that is. People used to whisper about it like it could hear them.
positive: By Shor… the Staff of Cinders. Dragon of Haafingar blood still walks, then.
Ooooh, gods—yeah. That's the staff. That's the real one.
negative: If that's the Staff of Cinders… then trouble's following you like wolves in snow.
Keep your heirloom close. Skyrim loves heroes… right up until it doesn't.

neutral: The Staff of Cinders… so the stories were true.
That staff changes the weight of a room. Be mindful where you carry it.
positive: You've inherited more than wood and metal—you've inherited a symbol. Use it well.
That relic belongs in legend… but it's in your hands. Make it mean something.
negative: Do you understand what people will do for that staff?
Power like that invites attention. Some of it will be deadly.
